answers.answer: Do you mean normal TSH?  Have you  had any other thyroid related tests done?  You should have had a Free T3 and Free T4 done, along with TSH.Please post your actual lab results so we can better assess your situation. Be sure to include reference ranges for all tests, since ranges vary lab to lab and have to come from your own report.Vomiting, nausea, fever are not, typically, symptoms of thyroid disorder.Have you been tested for vitamin B12 deficiency?  Fatigue, tiredness, tingling in fingers/toes are very common symptoms of B-12 deficiency.  Ask your doctor to test that.  Anything under 500 can cause symptoms, even though it falls within most reference ranges.

also have you had your vitamin d levels checks for deficiency.or..hormones, your age?... you need to keep going to a new dr until someone listens and addresses your pain....this is serious...your body is crying out for help

question: Extreme weight loss, fatigue, weakness, very tired, tingling in fingers n toes, vomiting nausea, random fevers , shaking , outer brow loss normal ths no diabetes plz help. Been going on for 2 yrs now .
title: undiagnosed still
